alert.note: Alert for Southeast Tularosa Basin; Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; West Central Tularosa Basin, White Sands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 6:28PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Otero, southeastern Dona Ana and northwestern El Paso Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 626 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West El Paso, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Blowing dust will likely cause reduced visibilities, especially in the more open areas. Locations impacted include... West El Paso, East El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Far East El Paso, Mission Valley, Chaparral, Santa Teresa, Anthony, Vado, Sunland Park, Canutillo, Anthony Gap, Berino, Vinton, Westway, Fort Bliss, Chamberino, La Union, and Mesquite. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 155 and 164. Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 33. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Tularosa Basin; Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; West Central Tularosa Basin, White Sands
